Recipe Name: Pasta with beef and creamy mushrooms
Ingredients: 250 g short pasta (e.g. fusilli), 400 g beef steak, 300 g mushrooms, 1 onion, ¬Ω tbsp thyme (dried), ¬Ω tbsp rosemary (dried), 100 ml white wine (dry), 150 ml heavy cream, olive oil for frying, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cook pasta until al dente. Cut onion into thin slices. Clean and quarter mushrooms. Cut meat into strips. Heat olive oil and saut√© mushrooms 5-8 min. Add onion and cook 2-3 min until translucent. Transfer to a plate. Add more olive oil and sear meat 2-3 min per side. Season with salt and pepper. Add herbs and deglaze with white wine. Let reduce briefly then add cream. Let simmer approx. 5 min until sauce thickens. Add onions and mushrooms back to pan. Season to taste and serve with pasta.
Nutrition: Cal 946, Fat 41 g, Protein 54 g, Carb 57 g

Ingredients: 1 kg beef stew meat, 700 ml beef stock, 250 ml red wine, 3 onions, 4 carrots, 2 stalks celery, 4 cloves garlic, 3 bay leaves, 4 sprigs thyme, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 2 tbsp flour, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut beef into 3-4 cm cubes. Season with salt and pepper and dust with flour. Dice onions, chop carrots and celery. Heat oil in a large pot and brown meat in batches on all sides approx. 3-4 min. Set aside. In the same pot, saut√© onions approx. 3 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 1 min. Deglaze with wine and beef stock. Return meat to pot with bay leaves and thyme. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer approx. 1.5 hrs. Add carrots and celery, cook another 30 min. Season to taste. Serve with bread or mashed potatoes.
Nutrition: Cal 611, Fat 30 g, Protein 54 g, Carb 24 g

Recipe Name: Beef banh mi with fresh cilantro
Ingredients: 2 baguettes, 300 g beef steak, 1 carrot, ¬Ω cucumber, 3 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 red chili, 20 g cilantro, 2 tbsp mayonnaise, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp fish sauce, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel carrot into ribbons. Slice cucumber thinly. Mix vinegar, sugar and salt. Add carrot and cucumber and let marinate. Slice chili and chop cilantro. Cut beef into thin strips. Heat oil in pan and fry beef 3-4 min. Season with soy sauce, fish sauce, salt and pepper. Cut baguettes in half lengthwise. Spread with mayonnaise. Drain pickled vegetables and arrange on baguettes with beef, chili and cilantro.
Nutrition: Cal 755, Fat 32 g, Protein 38 g, Carb 79 g

Ingredients: 800 g beef tenderloin, 500 g puff pastry, 300 g mushrooms, 150 g p√¢t√©, 8 slices prosciutto, 2 egg yolks, 2 shallots, 2 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp thyme, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Season beef with salt and pepper. Heat oil in pan and sear beef on all sides 2-3 min until browned. Set aside to cool. Finely chop mushrooms, shallots and garlic. Melt butter and saut√© shallots 2 min. Add mushrooms and garlic, cook 8-10 min until liquid evaporates. Add thyme, season with salt and pepper. Let cool. Lay out plastic wrap and arrange prosciutto slices in overlapping rows. Spread p√¢t√© over prosciutto, then mushroom mixture (duxelles). Place cooled beef on top and roll tightly using plastic wrap. Chill 30 min. Roll out puff pastry. Remove plastic from beef and place in center of pastry. Brush edges with egg yolk, fold pastry around beef and seal. Brush with remaining egg yolk. Bake at 200¬∞C/400¬∞F for 25-30 min until golden. Rest 10 min before slicing.
Nutrition: Cal 759, Fat 48 g, Protein 53 g, Carb 28 g

Recipe Name: Tagliatelle with beef and creamy pepper sauce
Ingredients: 250 g tagliatelle, 300 g beef steak, 200 ml heavy cream, 100 ml beef stock, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp peppercorns, 2 tbsp brandy, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, salt
Instructions: Cook pasta until al dente. Cut beef into strips. Crush peppercorns coarsely. Dice onion and mince garlic. Heat oil in pan and sear beef strips 2-3 min. Season with salt and crushed pepper. Set aside. In same pan, melt butter and saut√© onion 2-3 min. Add garlic briefly. Deglaze with brandy and let reduce. Add stock and cream, simmer 5 min. Return beef to pan. Toss with drained pasta. Serve immediately.
Nutrition: Cal 865, Fat 48 g, Protein 42 g, Carb 52 g

Ingredients: 200 g rice noodles, 300 g beef steak, 1 cucumber, 2 carrots, 4 spring onions, 30 g peanuts, 20 g mint, 20 g cilantro, 3 tbsp lime juice, 2 tbsp fish sauce, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 red chili, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, pepper
Instructions: Cook noodles according to package. Drain and rinse with cold water. Cut beef into thin strips, season with pepper. Heat oil and stir-fry beef 3-4 min. Set aside. Julienne cucumber and carrots. Slice spring onions. Chop peanuts, mint and cilantro. Mix lime juice, fish sauce, soy sauce and sugar. Toss noodles with vegetables, beef and dressing. Top with herbs, chili and peanuts.
Nutrition: Cal 612, Fat 22 g, Protein 38 g, Carb 64 g

Ingredients: 500 g beef sirloin, 500 g broccoli, 3 cloves garlic, 15 g ginger, 4 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1 tbsp sugar, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 100 ml water, sesame seeds
Instructions: Slice beef thinly against grain. Mix with 2 tbsp soy sauce and cornstarch, marinate 15 min. Cut broccoli into florets. Mince garlic and ginger. Blanch broccoli 2 min, drain. Heat oil in wok, stir-fry beef 3-4 min. Remove. Add more oil, saut√© garlic and ginger 30 sec. Add broccoli, remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar and water. Stir-fry 3-4 min. Return beef to wok, toss together. Garnish with sesame seeds.
Nutrition: Cal 453, Fat 18 g, Protein 43 g, Carb 34 g

Ingredients: 400 g ground beef, 400 g canned chickpeas, 400 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tsp cumin, 2 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili flakes, 20 g parsley, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Drain chickpeas. Dice onions and mince garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onions and garlic, cook 3 min. Add spices (cumin, paprika, chili), stir 1 min. Add tomatoes and chickpeas. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 15 min until sauce thickens. Chop parsley and stir in. Serve with rice or flatbread.
Nutrition: Cal 586, Fat 32 g, Protein 34 g, Carb 38 g

Recipe Name: 5-ingredient stir-fried udon noodles with spinach and beef
Ingredients: 300 g udon noodles, 250 g beef sirloin, 200 g spinach, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, 2 tbsp vegetable oil
Instructions: Cook udon according to package. Slice beef thinly. Heat oil in wok, stir-fry beef 3-4 min. Add spinach, cook 2 min until wilted. Add drained noodles, soy sauce and oyster sauce. Toss 2-3 min. Serve immediately.
Nutrition: Cal 728, Fat 24 g, Protein 36 g, Carb 88 g

Ingredients: 1 kg beef chuck, 300 g pearl onions, 300 g mushrooms, 200 g bacon, 4 carrots, 4 cloves garlic, 750 ml red wine, 250 ml beef stock, 3 tbsp tomato paste, 3 tbsp flour, 2 bay leaves, 4 sprigs thyme, 3 tbsp butter, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut beef into chunks, season with salt and pepper, coat with flour. Cut bacon into lardons. Peel pearl onions. Chop carrots. Quarter mushrooms. Brown beef in batches in butter, transfer to slow cooker. In same pan, cook bacon until crispy. Add onions and carrots, cook 5 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 min. Deglaze with wine and stock. Pour into slow cooker with beef. Add bay leaves and thyme. Cook on low 6-8 hrs. In last hour, saut√© mushrooms in butter and add to slow cooker. Season to taste.
Nutrition: Cal 542, Fat 24 g, Protein 46 g, Carb 22 g

Ingredients: 500 g beef sirloin, 300 g mushrooms, 300 g egg noodles, 200 ml sour cream, 500 ml beef stock, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp mustard, 2 tbsp paprika, 3 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour, salt, pepper, parsley
Instructions: Cut beef into strips. Slice mushrooms and onions. Mince garlic. Melt butter and brown beef 4-5 min. Remove beef. Add onions and mushrooms, cook 5 min. Add garlic and paprika, cook 1 min. Sprinkle with flour, stir. Add stock gradually. Add noodles and cook 8-10 min until tender. Stir in mustard and sour cream. Return beef to pot. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.
Nutrition: Cal 694, Fat 32 g, Protein 42 g, Carb 56 g

Recipe Name: Easy ginger beef and onion stir-fry
Ingredients: 600 g beef sirloin, 3 onions, 40 g ginger, 4 cloves garlic, 4 spring onions, 4 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, 2 tbsp rice wine, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, white pepper
Instructions: Slice beef thinly. Marinate with 2 tbsp soy sauce, rice wine, sugar and cornstarch for 20 min. Slice onions and ginger into strips. Mince garlic. Slice spring onions. Heat oil in wok, stir-fry beef in batches 2-3 min. Remove. Add more oil, saut√© ginger and garlic 1 min. Add onions, stir-fry 4-5 min. Return beef to wok with oyster sauce, remaining soy sauce and white pepper. Toss 2 min. Garnish with spring onions.
Nutrition: Cal 486, Fat 22 g, Protein 48 g, Carb 26 g

Ingredients: 500 g beef bones, 400 g beef brisket, 400 g rice noodles, 2 onions, 50 g ginger, 3 star anise, 2 cinnamon sticks, 5 cloves, 1 tbsp coriander seeds, 2 l water, 3 tbsp fish sauce, 200 g bean sprouts, 20 g cilantro, 20 g basil, 2 limes, 2 red chilies, salt
Instructions: Char onions and ginger under broiler. Toast spices in dry pan. Add bones, brisket, charred onions and ginger to pot with water. Bring to boil, skim foam. Add spices, fish sauce and salt. Simmer 2.5 hrs. Strain broth. Slice brisket thinly. Cook noodles according to package. Divide noodles into bowls, top with beef slices. Ladle hot broth over. Serve with bean sprouts, herbs, lime wedges and chilies.
Nutrition: Cal 524, Fat 12 g, Protein 38 g, Carb 68 g

Recipe Name: Keema curry (Spiced ground beef with potatoes)
Ingredients: 500 g ground beef, 400 g potatoes, 400 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 4 cloves garlic, 20 g ginger, 2 tbsp curry powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp turmeric, 200 ml water, 20 g cilantro, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, salt
Instructions: Dice potatoes. Chop onions. Mince garlic and ginger. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onions, cook 5 min. Add garlic, ginger and spices (curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric). Cook 2 min. Add tomatoes, potatoes and water. Season with salt. Simmer 20 min until potatoes are tender. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice or naan.
Nutrition: Cal 588, Fat 32 g, Protein 30 g, Carb 42 g

Ingredients: 300 g flat rice noodles, 300 g beef sirloin, 200 g bean sprouts, 3 spring onions, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp dark soy sauce, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, white pepper
Instructions: Soak rice noodles if dried. Slice beef thinly. Marinate with 1 tbsp soy sauce and cornstarch 15 min. Slice spring onions. Heat oil in wok, stir-fry beef 2-3 min. Remove. Add more oil, stir-fry noodles 3-4 min. Add bean sprouts, spring onions, remaining soy sauce, dark soy sauce and oyster sauce. Toss 2 min. Return beef to wok. Season with white pepper. Serve immediately.
Nutrition: Cal 746, Fat 26 g, Protein 38 g, Carb 88 g

Ingredients: 1.5 kg beef short ribs, 200 ml soy sauce, 100 ml mirin, 100 ml sake, 50 g sugar, 5 cloves garlic, 30 g ginger, 500 ml water, 2 spring onions, sesame seeds
Instructions: Cut ribs into pieces. Blanch in boiling water 5 min to remove excess fat. Drain. Slice ginger and garlic. In large pot, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar and water. Add ribs, ginger and garlic. Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer covered 2.5 hrs until tender. Uncover and simmer 30 min to reduce sauce. Slice spring onions. Serve ribs with sauce, garnished with spring onions and sesame seeds.
Nutrition: Cal 782, Fat 52 g, Protein 46 g, Carb 28 g

Ingredients: 550 g flank steak, 4 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice wine, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tsp sriracha, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp ginger, 2 green onions, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, sesame seeds, 300 g rice
Instructions: Freeze beef 1 hr for easier slicing. Slice thinly against grain. Mince garlic and ginger. Chop white parts of green onions. Mix soy sauce, rice wine, sugar, sesame oil, sriracha, garlic, ginger and white onion parts. Pour over beef and marinate 30 min. Toast sesame seeds. Heat oil in pan over high heat. Add beef with marinade and fry 6-8 min, stirring frequently. Slice green parts of onions and stir in. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with rice.
Nutrition: Cal 370, Fat 14 g, Protein 27 g, Carb 30 g

Ingredients: 4 slices beef shanks, 700 g sauerkraut, 500 ml beef stock, 250 ml red wine, 50 g smoked bacon, 4 onions, 2 pickles, 1 carrot, 2 cloves garlic, 4 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tbsp tomato paste, 1 tbsp butter, 4 tsp mustard, 1 bay leaf, salt, pepper, flour
Instructions: Cut bacon into cubes. Slice onions. Cut pickles into strips. Chop garlic and carrot. Saut√© bacon and half onions 2-3 min. Spread mustard on beef slices. Season with salt and pepper. Add bacon, onions and pickles. Roll up and tie with string. Brown rouladen 3-4 min per side. Remove. Add carrots, remaining onions, garlic and tomato paste, saut√© 2-3 min. Return rouladen. Deglaze with broth and wine. Add bay leaf, simmer covered 1.5 hrs. Remove rouladen, keep warm. Season sauce, thicken with flour if needed. Heat sauerkraut. Serve rouladen with sauce and sauerkraut.
Nutrition: Cal 679, Fat 33 g, Protein 63 g, Carb 23 g

Ingredients: 500 g beef soup meat, 500 ml beef stock, 200 ml water, 5 slices ginger, 1 scallion, 2 star anise, 2 bay leaves, 1 cinnamon stick, 2 tbsp fennel seeds, 2 dried chilis, 5 Sichuan peppercorns, 10 g sugar, 1 tbsp doubanjiang, 3 tbsp light soy sauce, 1 tbsp dark soy sauce, 300 g Asian wheat noodles, 4 heads bok choy, 10 g cilantro, vegetable oil
Instructions: Slice ginger. Cut scallion. Cut beef into chunks. Cover with water with 2 ginger slices. Boil 3 min. Drain and rinse. Heat oil, melt sugar until golden. Add beef, coat in sugar. Add remaining ginger, scallion, chili paste and spices. Fry until fragrant. Add soy sauces, stock and water. Simmer with lid 45 min until tender. Quarter bok choy. Cook noodles and bok choy together. Divide into bowls. Top with beef and soup. Garnish with cilantro and scallion.
Nutrition: Cal 619, Fat 19 g, Protein 45 g, Carb 69 g

Recipe Name: Zwiebelrostbraten (German beef roast in onion sauce)
Ingredients: 2 rump steaks, 1 onion, ¬Ω clove garlic, 400 g potatoes, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 2¬Ω tsp sugar, 1 bay leaf, ¬Ω tsp tomato paste, 60 ml red wine, 200 ml beef stock, 3 tbsp cold butter, salt, pepper, fried onions
Instructions: Slice onion thinly. Slice garlic. Boil potatoes in salted water 10 min. Heat 2 tbsp oil and saut√© onions until translucent. Add salt and 1 tsp sugar. Add bay leaf and fry 5-8 min. Add tomato paste and fry 5 min. Deglaze with wine, reduce. Add stock and simmer 10 min. Drain potatoes, peel and saut√© in 1 tbsp oil with 1¬Ω tsp sugar until golden. Season steaks with salt. Heat pan and sear steaks well on both sides. Add pepper. Wrap in foil and rest 3 min. Add butter to onion sauce, season. Serve steaks with sauce and potatoes. Garnish with fried onions.
Nutrition: Cal 1027, Fat 68 g, Protein 57 g, Carb 41 g

Ingredients: 150 g beef, 300 g udon noodles, 1 onion, 1 carrot, 1 scallion, 2 tbsp butter, 4 tbsp flour, 1 tbsp curry powder, 1 tbsp garam masala, 700 ml beef stock, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp mirin, vegetable oil, egg, shichimi togarashi
Instructions: Slice beef thinly. Chop onion, carrot and scallions. Melt butter and add flour, whisk until golden 5 min. Add curry powder and garam masala. Remove and wipe pan. Heat oil and brown beef. Add onions and carrots, saut√© 5 min. Add stock, soy sauce and mirin, cook 5-7 min. Add curry paste and stir until thick. Cook udon and bok choy. Divide into bowls. Ladle curry over noodles. Top with scallions, eggs and togarashi.
Nutrition: Cal 620, Fat 26 g, Protein 29 g, Carb 68 g

Ingredients: 1 beef steak, 1 ciabatta roll, ¬Ω red bell pepper, ¬Ω yellow bell pepper, ¬Ω red onion, 1 clove garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper, arugula, parmesan
Instructions: Slice peppers and onion. Mince garlic. Heat oil in pan, saut√© peppers and onion 5-7 min until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Add vinegar, season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Season steak with salt and pepper. Heat pan and sear steak 3-4 min per side for medium. Rest 5 min, then slice. Cut ciabatta in half. Layer arugula, sliced steak, peppers and onions. Shave parmesan on top.
Nutrition: N/A

Recipe Name: Creamy savoy cabbage, ground beef, and potato gratin
Ingredients: 800 g waxy potatoes, 400 g savoy cabbage, 400 g ground beef, 1 onion, 1 clove garlic, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour, 400 ml milk, ¬º tsp nutmeg, 1 tbsp mustard, salt, pepper, vegetable oil, chives
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/395¬∞F. Boil potatoes in salted water 20 min until tender. Drain. Blanch cabbage 3 min, rinse cold. Peel and slice potatoes. Mince onion and garlic. Melt butter, saut√© half onion and garlic 3 min. Add flour, whisk in milk gradually. Season with nutmeg, mustard, salt and pepper. Set aside. Brown ground beef with remaining onion and garlic 5 min. Season. Grease baking dish. Layer half potatoes, ground beef, cabbage, remaining potatoes. Pour b√©chamel over. Bake 20 min until golden. Garnish with chives.
Nutrition: Cal 505, Fat 23 g, Protein 30 g, Carb 59 g

Ingredients: 380 g veal tenderloin, 1 sprig rosemary, 2 cloves garlic, 150 g mushrooms, 1 onion, 50 ml white wine, 150 ml veal stock, 200 ml heavy cream, 2 sprigs thyme, 25 g cold butter, salt, pepper, vegetable oil, fleur de sel, potato r√∂sti
Instructions: Remove sinews from tenderloin. Vacuum seal and cook sous vide at 57¬∞C/135¬∞F for 1.5 hrs. Slice mushrooms and dice onion. Dice garlic. Heat oil, saut√© onion 2 min. Add mushrooms, fry 3-5 min. Deglaze with wine and stock. Add half garlic, simmer 10-15 min until reduced by half. Add cream, boil briefly. Season with thyme, salt and pepper. Stir in butter to bind. Remove tenderloin, pat dry. Season. Fry in oil until browned. Add rosemary and remaining garlic. Rest 3-4 min. Season with fleur de sel. Slice and serve with mushroom sauce and r√∂sti.
Nutrition: Cal 693, Fat 52 g, Protein 47 g, Carb 7 g

Ingredients: 400 g rib eye steaks, 90 g honey, 1 chili, 2 lemons, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, 50 g butter, 2 sprigs mint, salt, pepper, sunflower oil
Instructions: Juice half the lemons, quarter the rest. Deseed and slice chili. Mix honey, lemon juice, olive oil, chili and pepper. Salt steaks well. Crush garlic cloves. Heat sunflower oil in pan. Sear steaks 1 min each side, then fry 6 min total, turning halfway. Lower heat, add garlic and fry 1 min. Add butter and lemon wedges, baste steak 1 min. Add honey-lemon mixture and baste 2 more min. Rest 5 min. Slice and serve with sauce, garlic, lemon. Garnish with mint.
Nutrition: Cal 845, Fat 53 g, Protein 48 g, Carb 41 g

Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 500 g ground beef, 400 g canned kidney beans, 400 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 2 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 100 g cheddar cheese, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper, cilantro
Instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente. Dice onions and mince garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onions and garlic, cook 3 min. Add tomato paste, chili powder and cumin, stir 1 min. Add tomatoes and drained kidney beans. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 20 min. Toss with drained spaghetti. Grate cheddar on top. Garnish with cilantro.
Nutrition: Cal 780, Fat 32 g, Protein 44 g, Carb 82 g

Recipe Name: Beef meatballs with organic black bean fettuccine
Ingredients: 250 g black bean fettuccine, 300 g ground beef, 1 egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 400 g canned tomatoes, 1 tsp oregano, 50 g parmesan, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, basil
Instructions: Mix ground beef with egg, breadcrumbs, half diced onion, half minced garlic, salt and pepper. Form into meatballs. Heat 2 tbsp oil and brown meatballs 5-6 min. Set aside. In same pan, heat 1 tbsp oil and saut√© remaining onion and garlic 2-3 min. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 10 min. Return meatballs to sauce, cook 5 min. Cook pasta according to package. Toss with sauce and meatballs. Grate parmesan on top. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 654, Fat 28 g, Protein 48 g, Carb 54 g

Ingredients: 800 g ground beef, 800 g canned tomatoes, 200 ml red wine, 2 onions, 4 cloves garlic, 2 carrots, 2 celery stalks, 4 tbsp tomato paste, 200 ml milk, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp sugar, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, oregano
Instructions: Dice onions, carrots and celery. Mince garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min, breaking it up. Add vegetables, cook 8-10 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 min. Deglaze with wine, let reduce. Add tomatoes, milk, bay leaves, sugar, oregano, salt and pepper. Simmer uncovered 2 hrs, stirring occasionally. If too thick, add water. Serve with pasta.
Nutrition: Cal 332, Fat 20 g, Protein 24 g, Carb 12 g

Ingredients: 400 g lasagna sheets, 600 g ground beef, 800 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 4 cloves garlic, 2 carrots, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 100 ml red wine, 60 g butter, 60 g flour, 800 ml milk, 150 g mozzarella, 100 g parmesan, 3 tbsp olive oil, nutmeg, bay leaf, salt, pepper, oregano, basil
Instructions: Dice onions, carrots and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add vegetables, cook 5 min. Add tomato paste, wine, tomatoes, bay leaf, oregano, salt and pepper. Simmer 30 min. Make b√©chamel: melt butter, add flour, whisk 2 min. Add milk gradually, season with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Simmer 10 min. Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F. Layer sauce, pasta sheets, b√©chamel in greased baking dish. Repeat. Top with mozzarella and parmesan. Bake 40 min. Rest 10 min. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 456, Fat 20 g, Protein 26 g, Carb 42 g

Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 500 g ground beef, 400 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 carrots, 2 stalks celery, 3 tbsp tomato paste, 100 ml red wine, 100 ml milk, 1 bay leaf, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, parmesan, basil
Instructions: Dice onions, carrots, celery and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add vegetables, cook 5-8 min. Add tomato paste and garlic, cook 2 min. Deglaze with wine. Add tomatoes, milk and bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 45 min, stirring occasionally. Cook spaghetti until al dente. Toss with sauce. Grate parmesan on top. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 724, Fat 28 g, Protein 36 g, Carb 82 g

Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 500 g ground beef, 1 egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, 50 g parmesan, 2 cloves garlic, 400 g canned tomatoes, 1 onion, 1 tsp oregano, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, basil
Instructions: Mix ground beef with egg, breadcrumbs, half parmesan, half minced garlic, salt and pepper. Form into small meatballs. Heat 3 tbsp oil and brown meatballs in batches 5-6 min. Set aside. In same pan, heat 1 tbsp oil and saut√© diced onion 3 min. Add remaining garlic, cook 1 min. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 15 min. Return meatballs to sauce, cook 10 min. Cook pasta until al dente. Toss with sauce and meatballs. Grate remaining parmesan on top. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 814, Fat 34 g, Protein 42 g, Carb 82 g

Ingredients: 500 g ground beef, 100 g breadcrumbs, 2 eggs, 100 g parmesan, 3 cloves garlic, 20 g parsley, 400 g canned tomatoes, 1 onion, 1 tsp oregano, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Mix ground beef with breadcrumbs, eggs, half parmesan, half minced garlic, chopped parsley, salt and pepper. Form into meatballs. Heat 3 tbsp oil and brown meatballs in batches 6-8 min. Set aside. In same pan, heat 1 tbsp oil and saut√© diced onion 3 min. Add remaining garlic, cook 1 min. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 10 min. Add meatballs to sauce, simmer 15 min. Grate remaining parmesan on top. Serve with pasta or bread.
Nutrition: Cal 568, Fat 32 g, Protein 38 g, Carb 30 g

Ingredients: 800 g beef chuck, 400 g kidney beans, 800 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 4 cloves garlic, 2 red peppers, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tbsp cumin, 1 tbsp paprika, 1 tsp oregano, 200 ml beef stock, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, dark chocolate
Instructions: Cut beef into 2 cm cubes. Dice onions and peppers. Mince garlic. Heat oil and brown beef in batches 5 min. Set aside. Add onions and peppers, cook 5 min. Add garlic and spices (chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano), cook 2 min. Add tomato paste, stir 1 min. Return beef to pot with tomatoes and stock. Season with salt. Simmer covered 1.5 hrs. Add drained kidney beans, simmer 30 min. Stir in dark chocolate. Serve with rice, sour cream and tortilla chips.
Nutrition: Cal 516, Fat 24 g, Protein 44 g, Carb 32 g

Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 500 g ground beef, 400 g canned tomatoes, 200 ml heavy cream, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 100 ml red wine, 200 g mozzarella, 50 g parmesan, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, oregano, basil
Instructions: Dice onions and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onions, cook 3 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 min. Deglaze with wine. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 20 min. Cook spaghetti until just al dente. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F. Toss spaghetti with Bolognese sauce. Transfer to greased baking dish. Pour cream over. Top with torn mozzarella and grated parmesan. Bake 25 min until bubbly and golden. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 782, Fat 40 g, Protein 42 g, Carb 64 g

Ingredients: 600 g potatoes, 400 g ground veal, 1 egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, 2 onions, 200 ml heavy cream, 100 ml milk, 50 g butter, 2 tbsp horseradish, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper, nutmeg, chives
Instructions: Peel and boil potatoes in salted water 20 min until tender. Drain. Mix ground veal with egg, breadcrumbs, half diced onion, salt and pepper. Form into meatballs. Heat oil and brown meatballs 8-10 min. Set aside. Mash potatoes with butter, cream, milk and horseradish. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Saut√© remaining onion in butter until golden. Serve meatballs with horseradish mash and fried onions. Garnish with chives.
Nutrition: Cal 748, Fat 46 g, Protein 28 g, Carb 54 g

Ingredients: 500 g gnocchi, 500 g ground beef, 400 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 100 ml red wine, 150 g mozzarella, 50 g parmesan, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, oregano, basil
Instructions: Dice onions and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onions, cook 3 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 min. Deglaze with wine. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 20 min. Cook gnocchi according to package. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F. Mix gnocchi with Bolognese sauce. Transfer to greased baking dish. Top with torn mozzarella and grated parmesan. Bake 10-15 min until golden. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 686, Fat 32 g, Protein 38 g, Carb 58 g

Ingredients: 500 g ground beef, 1 egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, 3 cloves garlic, 20 g parsley, 400 g canned tomatoes, 1 onion, 100 ml white wine, 100 ml beef stock, 1 tsp paprika, ¬Ω tsp cumin, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Mix ground beef with egg, breadcrumbs, half minced garlic, chopped parsley, salt and pepper. Form into meatballs. Heat 3 tbsp oil and brown meatballs in batches 5-6 min. Set aside. In same pan, heat 1 tbsp oil and saut√© diced onion 3 min. Add remaining garlic, paprika and cumin, cook 1 min. Deglaze with wine. Add tomatoes and stock. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 10 min. Add meatballs to sauce, simmer 15-20 min. Serve with crusty bread or rice.
Nutrition: Cal 594, Fat 34 g, Protein 32 g, Carb 28 g

Ingredients: 800 g potatoes, 600 g ground beef, 2 carrots, 2 onions, 2 cloves garlic, 200 g peas, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 200 ml beef stock, 100 ml milk, 50 g butter, 100 g cheddar cheese, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp thyme, salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and boil potatoes in salted water 20 min until tender. Drain. Dice onions, carrots and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add vegetables, cook 5 min. Add tomato paste, cook 2 min. Add stock, Worcestershire sauce and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 15 min. Add peas, cook 5 min. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F. Mash potatoes with butter and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer meat mixture to greased baking dish. Spread mashed potatoes on top. Grate cheddar over. Bake 25 min until golden.
Nutrition: Cal 468, Fat 22 g, Protein 28 g, Carb 42 g

Ingredients: 500 g flour, 300 ml milk, 50 g butter, 1 egg, 20 g fresh yeast, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp salt, 2 tbsp baking soda, 8 veal sausages, coarse salt, mustard
Instructions: Warm milk. Dissolve yeast and sugar in milk. Add flour, melted butter, egg and salt. Knead 10 min until smooth. Cover and let rise 30 min. Divide dough into 8 pieces. Roll each into 50 cm rope. Shape into pretzels. Let rise 20 min. Bring large pot of water to boil with baking soda. Boil pretzels 30 sec each side. Place on greased baking sheet. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake at 200¬∞C/390¬∞F for 15 min until golden. Meanwhile, cook veal sausages in simmering water 10 min. Serve pretzels with sausages and mustard.
Nutrition: Cal 487, Fat 18 g, Protein 22 g, Carb 58 g

Ingredients: 500 g ground beef, 1 egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, 50 g parmesan, 2 cloves garlic, 800 g canned tomatoes, 1 onion, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp basil, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Mix ground beef with egg, breadcrumbs, half parmesan, half minced garlic, salt and pepper. Form into meatballs. Heat 3 tbsp oil and brown meatballs in batches 5-6 min. Set aside. In same pan, heat 1 tbsp oil and saut√© diced onion 3 min. Add remaining garlic, cook 1 min. Add tomatoes, oregano and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 10 min. Add meatballs to sauce, simmer 15-20 min. Grate remaining parmesan on top. Serve with pasta or bread.
Nutrition: Cal 612, Fat 32 g, Protein 36 g, Carb 36 g

Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 500 g ground beef, 400 g canned tomatoes, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, salt, pepper, parmesan, basil
Instructions: Dice onion and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onion, cook 3 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 min. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 20 min. Cook spaghetti until al dente. Toss with sauce. Grate parmesan on top. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 698, Fat 28 g, Protein 34 g, Carb 78 g

Ingredients: 3 zucchini, 500 g ground beef, 400 g canned tomatoes, 2 onions, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 250 g ricotta, 200 g mozzarella, 50 g parmesan, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, salt, pepper, basil
Instructions: Slice zucchini lengthwise into thin strips. Salt and let drain 20 min. Pat dry. Dice onions and garlic. Heat oil and brown ground beef 5 min. Add onions, cook 3 min. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 min. Add tomatoes and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 15 min. Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F. Layer meat sauce, zucchini strips, ricotta in greased baking dish. Repeat. Top with mozzarella and parmesan. Bake 35 min. Rest 10 min. Garnish with basil.
Nutrition: Cal 412, Fat 24 g, Protein 34 g, Carb 14 g

Ingredients: 250 g spaghetti, 250 g ground beef, 250 g ground pork, 100 g ciabatta bread, 120 ml milk, 2 onions, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp butter, 60 g parsley, 20 g Parmesan cheese, 1 egg, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp sugar, ¬º tsp ground nutmeg, ¬º tsp white pepper, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 pinch chili flakes, 800 g canned crushed tomatoes, salt, pepper
Instructions: For the meatballs, chop or tear ciabatta bread into small pieces and place in a bowl. Add the milk, mash together with a fork, and let sit for approx. 15 min. In the meantime, finely chop half of the onions and half of the garlic. Fry the onion in the butter for approx. 10 min, until soft and golden. Add the garlic and fry for another 30 sec., then transfer to a small bowl to cool. Finely chop parsley and grate Parmesan. To the soaked breadcrumbs, add egg, salt, sugar, nutmeg, white pepper, black pepper, the chopped parsley, and grated parmesan. Add the fried onion and garlic to the breadcrumb mixture, and thoroughly mix. Add the beef and pork mince, gently mix together with a wooden spoon or your hands, until the mixture is homogeneous. Do not overmix. Set aside. For the sauce, finely chop remaining onion and finely slice remaining garlic. In a large pot, fry the onion, seasoned with salt and pepper, in some olive oil for approx. 10 min. until soft and golden. Add the garlic and chilli flakes and fry for another minute. Add crushed tomatoes, stir, and simmer on a low heat for approx. 50 min. In the meantime, fill a bowl with water and line a baking sheet or cutting board with baking paper. Form approx. 20 meatballs the size of table tennis balls, by gently rotating the mixture between wet hands, then place on the baking paper. Heat a large frying pan on medium heat and add the rest of the olive oil. Add half of the meatballs and fry for approx. 10 min., gently flipping with a spatula halfway through. Don't overcrowd the pan to ensure they get a golden brown exterior. Once cooked, remove and place them in a bowl, along with any brown bits on the bottom of the pan. Repeat in batches, as needed, until used up. Add spaghetti to salted boiling water and cook until al dente. About halfway through the cooking of the spaghetti, add a large ladle of pasta water into the tomato sauce. Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning. Then add the meatballs and gently stir through and simmer for another few minutes until warmed through. Drain the spaghetti and add to the sauce, along with some parsley, and gently stir. Serve and garnish with some more parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 965, Fat 47 g, Protein 34 g, Carb 108 g

Ingredients: 1 kg beef brisket, 3 tomatoes, 2 red pointed peppers, ¬Ω package parsley, 3 cloves garlic, ¬º tbsp olive oil, 65 g almonds, 1 lemon, 1 dash salt, 3¬Ω tbsp brown sugar, 3 tbsp salt, 1 tsp ground cumin, ¬Ω tsp ground coriander, ¬Ω tsp garlic powder, 1 tbsp Ground black peppercorn, 1¬Ω tbsp Beef Stock powder, 1 onion, 3 leaves bay leaves, ¬º tsp dried oregano, ¬Ω tsp dried rosemary
Instructions: First take the brisket and trim it if there is too much fat and then combine all the seasoning and cover the brisket with it and let it rest for at least 2-3 hours to allow the seasoning to get all the way through to the center of the brisket ( also you could let it rest overnight in the fridge) Now on to making the romesco sauce, cut the tomatoes and peppers in half (you can de-seed the pepper if you want to decrease the heat) and the. Roast them with the garlic in the oven on 180c for 15-25 mins and check them every 5 mins to make sure that they aren't burned. After the tomatoes, peppers and garlics finish roasting add them in the blender with the almonds, parsley, olive oil and the juice of the lemon. After blending the romesco sauce, taste it and add salt and sugar to taste. Now cut the onion into crescents (half-circles). Get an oven proof pot and lay 1/2 the onion, bay leaves, oregano and rosemary then lay the brisket on top of them and then put the rest of the onion, bay leaves, oregano and rosemary on top of the brisket. Cover the whole brisket with the romesco sauce and then cover the oven proof pot with a tin foil and put it in the oven for 3 hours on 165C. After 3 hours take the tin foil out and continue cooking the brisket for half an hour on 165C. Take the brisket out and let it rest for 10-15 minutes and then it's ready to serve. A beautiful brisket with romesco sauce. And if you have some time it goes well with some rice and vegetables. But most importantly please do enjoy and tell me if you have any ideas on how to make it even betterüòãüëçüèº.
Nutrition: N/A

Ingredients: 1000 g beef brisket, 1 onion, 5 bay leaves, 1000 g potatoes, 500 g tomatoes, 1 lettuce, 5 avocados, 4 tbsp vinegar, 4 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp dried oregano, salt, pepper
Instructions: Salt the brisket. Cook the brisket in a slow cooker along 1/2 onion and the bay leaves for at least 4 hours on high. Boil the potatoes and slice them into small cubes. Allow both the potatoes and brisket to cool down to room temperature. When meat is cool enough shred it. Dice the tomatoes and the avocadoes in small cubes. Cut the rest of the onion in julienne strips. Finely shred the lettuce. To prepare your vinaigrette whisk the olive oil and the vinegar along with the oregano. Mix the meat, lettuce, onion, potatoes, avocado, and tomatoes in a large bowl. Add the vinaigrette and season with salt and pepper. Serve with tostadas and a home made salsa. Enjoy!
Nutrition: N/A

Ingredients: 400 g beef tenderloin, 2 cloves garlic, 2 sprigs rosemary, 4 sprigs thyme, olive oil (for coating), salt, pepper
Instructions: For the steak, preheat the oven to 90¬∞C/194¬∞F. Carefully squash the garlic cloves with a knife and peel. Brush the steaks with a little oil, season with salt and pepper and place in a baking dish with the herbs and peeled garlic cloves. Cook the steaks in the oven for approx. 50‚Äì60 min. or until the core temperature reaches the desired doneness (approx. 54‚Äì55¬∞C/129‚Äì131¬∞F for medium). Heat a steel or cast-iron pan over high heat (we do not recommend using a non-stick or Teflon pan). Place the steaks, herbs, and garlic in the pan straight from the oven. Sear for approx. 2 min. on each side, remove and leave to rest for 10‚Äì15 min. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 509, Fat 36 g, Protein 40 g, Carb 3 g

Ingredients: Steak (Preferably Rib-Eye or Sirloin but any will do), ¬Ω tbsp olive oil, ¬Ω tbsp salt, ¬º tbsp smoked paprika powder, ¬º tbsp chili powder
Instructions: Prepare steak by sprinkling the salt, paprika & chilli powder onto the meat. Add a drizzle of olive oil and gently rub to create a thin coating. Repeat the previous step and ensure that the pan is heating up before proceeding. Place the steak onto the pan and set a timer for 6 minutes. (add another minute if the steak is thick). Turn the steak every minute until fully cooked. Serve with a portion of chips and some spicy mayonnaise and accompany with a beer or glass of red wine.
Nutrition: N/A

Ingredients: 500 g beef minute steaks, salt, pepper, 60 g butter, olive oil, 3 loaves garlic
Instructions: Season with salt and pepper. Let it rest for a bit. Place it on the well-heated pan with olive oil for about 3 minutes. Turn it over and add garlic with butter. Cook for another 3 to 4 minutes and glaze it with butter all the time. Take it off and serve with the rest of oil. You are good to go with your juicy medium rare stacke!
Nutrition: N/A

Recipe Name: How to reverse sear a steak
Ingredients: 1 beef entrec√¥te (bone in), 10 g rosemary, 50 g butter, fleur de sel
Instructions: Make sure the beef is at room temperature before cooking. Transfer the bone-in beef entrec√¥te directly to an oven rack positioned over a baking sheet in a preheated oven and bake at 50¬∞C/120¬∞F for approx. 2 hrs., flipping once. When internal temperature reaches 50¬∞C/120¬∞F, remove steak from the oven and transfer to a preheated grill pan over high heat. Sear for approx. 2 min. per side. Add rosemary and butter, then carefully tilt pan and baste steak in melted butter with a spoon. Remove steak from pan and transfer to an aluminum foil-lined plate with rosemary and wrap in aluminum foil and let rest for approx. 5 min. Remove from aluminum foil and transfer to a cutting board. Slice off the bone and into thick pieces. Serve with rosemary and plenty of fleur de sel. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 553, Fat 37 g, Protein 55 g, Carb 1 g

Recipe Name: New York Strip Steak (with Garlic Butter)
Ingredients: 330 g New York Strip Steak (3/4 inch), 2 pinches salt, 2 pinches crushed black pepper, 3 tbsp butter, 2 cloves garlic, 1 sprig thyme, 2 tbsp canola oil
Instructions: Season steak with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat skillet over medium-high heat until smoking. Add canola oil to skillet. Lay steak to sear for 1 minute and 30 seconds on the first side. Do not touch the meat. Flip to sear other side for the same amount of time. Add butter, garlic, and thyme. Baste over meat for last 30 seconds. Take steak off pan and let rest for at least 5 minutes before slicing.
Nutrition: N/A
